headline: LinkedIn deepens video ad push, taps more publishers and creators to spur growth
summary: (Reuters) -LinkedIn is expanding its video advertising program, adding new publishers and creator-led shows to draw marketing dollars.  The Microsoft-owned platform for professionals said on Monday that AT&T Business, IBM, SAP and ServiceNow will sponsor the debut season of four video programs as part of an expansion of its BrandLink program.  Launched last year as a publisher-focused Wire Program, LinkedIn rebranded it in May to include creators.

headline: AI Disruption Fear Sparks Investor Scrutiny of Software Stocks
summary: A Morgan Stanley basket of software-as-service stocks has fallen more than 6% this year, compared with an 11% advance for the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100.

headline: In the Age of AI, some tech leaders think communications degrees may actually be more valuable than computer science degrees
summary: Can a two-year ‘problem-solving pool’ solve AI replacing entry-level jobs? This C-suite executive thinks so.

headline: How the Bundesliga Partnership Has Reshaped ServiceNow's (NOW) Global Expansion Investment Story
summary: Earlier this week, the DFL Deutsche Fußball Liga announced a technology partnership making ServiceNow the Official Workflow Partner for Germany’s Bundesliga, implementing its AI platform to overhaul legacy systems and automate business workflows across the league’s global network. This collaboration places ServiceNow at the heart of one of the world’s most iconic sports leagues, highlighting the company's expanding reach in digital transformation and fan engagement through AI-powered...
